header.title: The DustBunnies/MarchHares Big Damn Handout Volume I
header.category: Western Esotericism, Occultism, Feri Tradition, Magic

central_thesis: The Feri Tradition, as interpreted and practiced by Valerie Walker (veedub), serves as a dynamic and evolving 'tool kit' for self-transformation and engaging with the perennial philosophy. It emphasizes individual truth, living with paradox, balancing skepticism and belief, and integrating various core concepts like the Three Souls, Black Heart of Innocence, and the Pentacles, alongside personalized ritual practices to achieve alignment and connection with the divine.

structure_content.chapter_title: Lesson 1: Everything You Know Is Wrong
structure_content.summary: Introduces the author's personal journey into Feri Witchcraft, highlighting its core beliefs as transmitted by Victor Anderson (Three Souls, Black Heart of Innocence, Iron/Pearl Pentacles, Star Goddess, Divine Twins, sacred sexuality, kala) and emphasizing its evolving, individualized nature as a path of self-transformation rather than fixed doctrine.

Outlines the importance of daily spiritual practice for inner alchemy. Introduces 'The Flower Prayer' for aligning the three souls and 'The Black Heart Of Innocence' as a fundamental Feri concept emphasizing sexual sacredness and purity, serving as a basis for further self-inquiry.

Provides a detailed explanation of the Feri concept of the Three Souls (Vivi, Emi, Ori), their bodily associations, energetic forms (mana, mana-mana, mana-loa), and functions. It describes 'kala' as the state of alignment and includes practical exercises like 'Making Kala' and 'Shower Kala' for purification and energy work.

Introduces the Iron, Pearl, and Blessing Pentacles as central meditational and diagnostic tools within Feri. It explains their historical development from a single Decagram and their association with the Three Souls, emphasizing personal interpretation in their application.

structure_content.chapter_title: Lesson 5: Vivi And The Iron Pentacle Points
structure_content.summary: Presents hands-on exercises for engaging with the Iron Pentacle points (Sex, Pride, Self, Power, Passion) through the Fetch (Vivi), focusing on direct, non-intellectual processing of personal shadow aspects and creative impulses. Exercises include mirror work, sculpting, life masks, divination, and spellcraft.

structure_content.chapter_title: Lesson 6: Emi And The Pearl Pentacle
structure_content.summary: Focuses on exercises for the Pearl Pentacle points (Love, Law, Knowledge, Liberty, Wisdom) as accessed through the Emi (Talker) soul. It highlights the role of poetic thinking and riddles in developing the conscious mind, including a guided meditation for solitary or group practice.

structure_content.chapter_title: Lesson 7: Ori And The Blessing Pentacle
structure_content.summary: Introduces the author's 'Blessing Pentacle' (Devotion, Truth, Radiance, Grace, Blessing) as a higher octave corresponding to the Ori (Godself) for accepting divine gifts and embodying one's true nature. It includes a guided meditation and solitary working for each point.

Offers a series of diagnostic tools and diagrams to help practitioners identify and address energetic imbalances or blockages within the Pentacle system, encouraging personalized assessment and a playful, intuitive approach to self-work.

structure_content.chapter_title: Lesson 9: The Ladder Of Hestia: a meditation
structure_content.summary: Details a meditation practice for running energy upward through the chakras, invoking specific goddesses (Gula, Anat, Tanit, Isis, Neith, Psyche, Kore) to cultivate positive qualities and connect with divine forces. It also includes a 'Descent Of Inanna' variation for dispelling blockages downward.

Explores various practical magical techniques within the Feri tradition, including grounding, centering, invocation (Candle Goddesses/Gods chants), self-work, healing energy transmission via the Iron Pentacle ('Psychic Dragonstar'), and methods for banishing and 'CyberBinding' against ill-wishing, emphasizing ethical considerations.

Discusses key Feri deities, including the Star Goddess (the ultimate source), the Lemniscate Gods (Blue God, Nimue, Krom, Mari, Anna, Arddhu), and the Divine Twins, exploring their mythological significance and diverse interpretations within different Feri lineages.

Describes the Feri Guardians (Nephilim, Watchtowers, Korylan) as elemental principles associated with cardinal directions and higher/lower planes, outlining their powers and roles. It includes a specific ritual, the 'Feri Lesser Banishing Ritual of the Pentagram', for invoking protection and clarity.

structure_content.chapter_title: Lesson 13: The Pentacles and the Tree
structure_content.summary: Examines the theoretical connections between the Feri Pentacles and the Qabalistic Tree of Life, exploring potential Thelemic influences on Feri lore. It discusses mapping the Pentacle points to Sephiroth and the significance of the 'Path of the Lightning Flash/Sword' for deeper understanding of self and cosmos.

Outlines a comprehensive 'Faery Circle, Compost Style' ritual for creating sacred space, invoking elemental and directional Guardians, and performing magical operations. It also provides a 'Daily Practice Script' to integrate core Feri principles and energy work into everyday life.

key_concepts.definition: A dynamic and evolving magical tradition, viewed as a 'tool kit' for self-transformation and engagement with the 'perennial philosophy,' emphasizing living with paradox and individual truth rather than fixed doctrines. It is based on teachings from Victor Anderson and personalized by practitioners.

The core Feri concept of human consciousness being composed of three individual yet interdependent selves: Vivi (Fetch/Child Self), Emi (Talker/Conscious Mind), and Ori (Godself/Higher Self), each with distinct functions and energetic associations.

The 'Child Self' or 'Sticky One' associated with the lower torso, physical body functions, sensations, emotions, and basic life-force ('mana'). It is the realm of the Iron Pentacle and holds creative impulses and shadow aspects.

The 'Talking Self' or conscious mind, associated with the upper torso to the third eye, responsible for communication, linear thought, and relating to consensus reality. It amplifies mana into 'mana-mana' and is the realm of the Pearl Pentacle.

The 'Sacred Dove' or 'Higher Self' associated with the skull and transpersonal chakras, representing divine connection, intuition, and the ability to destroy the status quo. It generates 'mana-loa' and is the realm of the Blessing Pentacle.
A Huna term adopted in Feri referring to a state of purification, the reclaiming of bound energy, clearing spiritual obstacles, and achieving alignment among the Three Souls within the body.
The basic life force or substance collected from the Earth by Vivi, underpinning all living things and serving as the raw material for magical work.
Mana amplified by the conscious intent of Emi, used for communication, thought, and maintaining conscious reality.

An exponentially more powerful form of divine energy, often referred to as the 'blue fire of the Gods,' which emanates from Ori and is used for profound healing and creation, but is considered dangerous if misused.

A core Feri concept representing the sacred, lascivious purity of sex and the acceptance of oneself as a sexual being. It challenges societal taboos by viewing black as pure (like the night) and sensuality as divine.

A five-pointed star meditation/ritual device focused on the points of Sex, Self, Passion, Pride, and Power. It is primarily associated with Vivi and is used to confront and integrate personal shadow aspects and problematic energies.

A five-pointed star meditation/ritual device focused on the points of Love, Law, Knowledge, Liberty, and Wisdom. It is primarily associated with Emi and is used to cultivate desired virtues and higher aspirations.

The author's original five-pointed star meditation/ritual device focused on Devotion, Truth, Radiance, Grace, and Blessing. It is associated with Ori and is used to accept divine gifts, embody one's authentic self, and radiate spiritual presence.

A multi-stage meditation involving running energy through the body's chakras, from root to crown and beyond, invoking specific goddesses at each point to achieve grounding, healing, clarity, courage, and spiritual connection. It can also be reversed for dispelling blockages (Descent of Inanna).

Also known as Watchtowers or Korylan, these are segments of the universe or manifestations of Elemental-principles (Air, Fire, Water, Earth, Above, Below, Center) invoked for protection, guidance, and to define sacred space in Feri rituals.

The ultimate divine source in Feri, referred to as 'God Herself,' the immanent ground of being from which all things emerge and return. She is often seen as the unknowable, illimitable circumference that is also the center.

practical_system.description: The practical system presented is a highly adaptable and personally tailored approach to Feri magic, centered on self-transformation and energetic mastery. It integrates daily spiritual practices, chakra work (Ladder of Hestia), and meditations on the Three Souls (Vivi, Emi, Ori) and their corresponding Pentacles (Iron, Pearl, Blessing). The system emphasizes cultivating 'kala' (alignment), manipulating different forms of mana (mana, mana-mana, mana-loa), and engaging in ritual acts to integrate shadow aspects, develop virtues, and connect with the divine. It encourages practitioners to 'rewire' their own brains and personalize the techniques, fostering an intuitive and experiential path to magical competence.

relevant_quotes.text: To me the Feri Tradition is not a set of doctrines; it's a tool kit, it's a way of being in (and between) the worlds. It's one way of entry (among many others) into the perennial philosophy which has existed since the human race began. It's constantly evolving and changing, like all other living things. To pin it down is to kill it.
It is the ability to live with paradox, to balance the inner believer and the inner skeptic.
This is a book about self-transformation using Feri tools. It's not about how to do Feri—it's about how I do Feri.

There is a fairly simple core of beliefs and practices, which the late Feri teacher and Grandmaster Victor Anderson transmitted to many students over the years. These include the concepts of the Three Souls, the Black Heart of Innocence, the Iron and Pearl Pentacles, belief in and devotion to the Star Goddess and the Divine Twins, the sacred nature of sexuality, and the practice of “keeping kala,” all of which will be elucidated below.
How beautiful is the black lascivious purity in the hearts of children and wild animals.
God is Self and Self is God and God is a person like myself.
Blue fire is deadly dangerous, but it's also very beneficial, and very necessary in magic, but it has to be used properly
The kingdom of god is within YOU.
Power stay in, world stay out!

critical_analysis.relevance: Valerie Walker's 'Big Damn Handout' offers a deeply personalized and practical exposition of the Feri Tradition, providing a crucial insight into 'Compost-style Feri' — a lineage known for its improvisational and intuitive approach ('whatever works'). Its relevance lies in demonstrating how foundational Feri concepts (Three Souls, Pentacles, Kala) are reinterpreted and integrated with other esoteric currents (Huna, Qabalah, Chaos Magic) for individual self-transformation. The text serves as a valuable case study in the evolution of modern magical traditions, showcasing how a system can remain robust while allowing for significant personal adaptation and 'rewiring.' It directly addresses the operative side of Feri, making it a functional manual for practitioners, while also offering rich material for academic analysis of syncretism and contemporary occult practice.
critical_analysis.target_audience: The primary target audience consists of advanced practitioners and initiates of the Feri Tradition, particularly those within or interested in the 'Compost-style' lineage, seeking to deepen their understanding of its philosophy and practical applications. It also strongly appeals to academic researchers and experienced occultists in Western Esotericism and Magic who engage in comparative studies of magical systems, the development of modern Paganism, and practices focused on psychological integration and self-alchemy. The depth of technical detail and presumed familiarity with occult concepts suggests it is less suited for absolute beginners without prior magical or esoteric exposure.
